meanings.definition: To assist or aid in the performance of a task.
meanings.sent1: I will subminister you in completing the project on time.
meanings.sent2: She always subministers her friends when they need help with homework.
meanings.sent3: The robot tried to subminister in cooking, but ended up making a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude subministered energy to the whole team.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's guidance subministered clarity to the confusing assignment.

meanings.definition: To provide or distribute something, such as a service or product.
meanings.sent1: The charity organization subministers food to the homeless every week.
meanings.sent2: The company subministers essential supplies to remote areas.
meanings.sent3: The vending machine decided to subminister snacks for free that day.
meanings.sent4: Her smile subministered warmth to everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The library subministered knowledge through its vast collection of books.

meanings.definition: To act as a subordinate or assistant in a position of authority.
meanings.sent1: He was happy to subminister under the wise leadership of his mentor.
meanings.sent2: The intern subministered diligently to the CEO's requests.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to subminister in the dog's role as the guard of the house.
meanings.sent4: Her role was to subminister support to the team without seeking recognition.
meanings.sent5: The loyal dog subministered loyalty to its owner in every situation.
